results.adx_keywords: Snow and Snowstorms;Northeastern States (US);New York City
results.byline: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and MARC SANTORA
results.title: Storm Leaves Northeast Reeling and Digging
results.abstract: A midwinter storm buried several states in snow, leaving behind a debilitated region digging through plump white drifts and reeling from gale-force winds.

media.caption: Hundreds of people and more than a few dogs took advantage of a snowy Prospect Park in Brooklyn, N.Y.
At Gedney Park in New Castle, N.Y., children took to the snowy hills on sleds and tubes.
Bruce Vienneau, 61, shovel in hand, worked to clear his driveway in Carlisle, Mass., on Saturday, the second day of a giant storm that dropped more than two feet of snow in parts of Massachusetts.
media.copyright: Evan McGlinn for The New York Times

media.caption: People began to dig out in Westchester, N.Y.

results.adx_keywords: Leicester (England);Richard III, King of England;University of Leicester;Skeletons;Archaeology;Great Britain
results.title: Bones Under Parking Lot Belonged to Richard III
results.abstract: In one of Britain’s most dramatic modern archaeological finds, tests identified the remains of the reviled English monarch, a discovery that could lead to a reassessment of his reign.

media.caption: The skeleton found last fall near the buried ruins of the Greyfriars Priory in Leicester was confirmed on Monday by a team of experts to be that of King Richard III.
Michael Ibsen is one of two descendants of Richard IIIâ€™s sister, Anne of York, whose DNA was used to confirm the identity of the skeleton found beneath a parking lot in Leicester.
media.copyright: Andrew Testa for The New York Times

media.caption: Skeletal remains found in an English parking lot, including a tortuously curved spine, were confirmed as those of Richard III.
The skeleton found last fall near the buried ruins of the Greyfriars Priory in Leicester was confirmed on Monday by a team of experts to be that of King Richard III.

results.adx_keywords: Gluten; Celiac Disease; Digestive Tract; Grain; Medicine and Health
results.title: Gluten-Free, Whether You Need It or Not
results.abstract: Avoiding gluten is a must for those with celiac disease, but many people are going gluten-free in a bid for a healthy diet.

results.title: Storm’s Heavy Snow and High Winds Lash at the Northeast
results.abstract: After a day of pelting wet snow, five states had called states of emergency, and Massachusetts had banned cars from every road in the state. Conditions quickly worsened after dusk fell.

results.title: Why Can Some Kids Handle Pressure While Others Fall Apart?
results.abstract: Scientists think bouts of panic in stressful situations can be traced to genetics. But don’t freak out. Biology is not necessarily destiny.

results.adx_keywords: Weather;Snow and Snowstorms;Northeastern States (US);New York City;Massachusetts
results.title: Flights and Trains Canceled as Storm Heads to Northeast
results.abstract: Local authorities from New York City to Maine were preparing Thursday for what forecasters said could be the heaviest snowfall to hit some cities in the Northeast in a century.

media.caption: In Jersey City, Jose Angelo, left, helped Isauro Palacios, a contractor from Belleville, N.J., as he loaded a new snow blower into the back of his truck Thursday as a snowstorm approached the region.

A satellite image taken at 10:15 p.m. Eastern time Thursday. Areas in blue indicate colder cloud tops or deeper cloud cover. The system over the Midwest and the system spread across the East are expected to merge on Friday.
In Jersey City, Jose Angelo, left, helped Isauro Palacios, a contractor from Belleville, N.J., as he loaded a new snow blower into the back of his truck Thursday as a snowstorm approached the region.

results.byline: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and IAN LOVETT
results.title: Manhunt On for Ex-Officer Accused of Police Vendetta
results.abstract: The Los Angeles police said a former officer was targeting members of the department and their families. His truck was found burned near a ski area east of Los Angeles.

media.caption: A police cruiser in which an officer was shot in Corona, Calif.
Christopher J. Dorner, sought in three killings.
The truck, mistaken for one driven by the former officer who is on the run, was shot upon by police. The occupants were not hurt.
One victim, Monica Quan, 28, was the daughter of a former Los Angeles police captain whom the suspect had named as a target.
media.copyright: Matt Brown/Cal State Fullerton, via Associated Press

media.caption: Freeway signs urged drivers to look out for the suspect's vehicle.
A police cruiser in which an officer was shot in Corona, Calif.

results.adx_keywords: Mammals;Paleontology;Evolution;Fossils;Science (Journal);National Science Foundation;American Museum of Natural History;Carnegie Museum of Natural History;O'Leary, Maureen A
results.title: Rat-Size Ancestor Said to Link Man and Beast
results.abstract: A lowly occupant of the fossil record, Protungulatum donnae, had anatomical characteristics for live births that anticipated all placental mammals, a Science report says.

media.caption: An artistâ€™s rendering of a placental ancestor. Researchers say the small, insect-eating animal is the most likely common ancestor of the species on the most abundant and diverse branch of the mammalian family tree.
